content.title: Telecom Technology Development Fund
content.beneficiary: Domestic Companies, Startups, MSMEs, Academic Institutions
content.details: Telecommunication technology products require significantly large funding and long gestation periods for R&D and commercialization including the additional efforts and resources for the products to move from prototype to commercial grade. The scheme aims to bridge the digital divide by developing and manufacturing state-of-the-art technologies for rural and remote areas.
benefits: Technology Ownership and indigenous Manufacturing (Atmanirbhar Bharat)
Proliferation of next-generation Telecom technologies in Rural and Remote areas
Creating a culture of Technology co-creation and co-innovation
Promote the ecosystem for research, design, prototyping, development, proof of concept testing, IPR creation, field testing, security, certification, and manufacturing of telecom products
Promote rural-specific communication technology application/use case development
Create synergies among the Academia, Research Institutes, Start-ups, and Industry
Bridge the gap between R&D and commercialization of products and solutions
Enable proliferation of affordable broadband and mobile services
Enable technology demonstration, product integration, pilots, and field trials
Commercialize developed technologies under the scheme
eligibility: Domestic Company(ies) with focus on telecom R&D
R&D institutions, Section 8 companies / Societies, Central & State government entities / PSUs / Autonomous Bodies / SPVs / Limited liability partnerships
Collaborative consortium of the above entities
For Pilots: The above entities may partner with PSUs, TSPs, Central/State Government entities
exclusions: When an Indian Company receives a grant under the scheme, it is envisaged to retain its status as a ‘Domestic Company’ for a minimum period of two (2) years after completion of the project.
If a foreign investor wishes to acquire a majority stake within the above two-year period, the company can do so by paying twice the grant principal amount received.
content.application_process: Online submission of Proposal followed by screening, review, and final approval from Competent Authority.
documents_required: TAN/ PAN/ CIN of primary applicant/organization

faqs.question: In the application form there is a section for lead investors. Does it stand for founder/ head of the organisation?
faqs.answer: In the application, the applicant should mention the details of Investors. In the case of a consortium, the primary applicant should be mentioned.

faqs.question: Is renting of workspaces an eligible activity for funding?
faqs.answer: The land building etc. shall not be a part of eligible expenditure for the funding.

faqs.question: Is there any preference for proposal from applicant type like startup, MSME, Government Institute, PSU, Academia or other registered organisation?
Is it allowed to have any executive summary document or any additional supporting document along with the application form?
faqs.answer: Yes, there is an option to add additional document.

faqs.question: Is any domestic telecom R&D company eligible or only MSME and start-up?
faqs.answer: Please refer to clause-6 of TTDF guidelines available on USOF website.
